4-3GvEGBB0g-hi2PsnGDpA.text: I like when people give me free stuff.  I popped in here on Tuesday when I just wasn't feeling so hot, and ordered a take away simple margarita pizza.  When the guy brought out my pizza ($18) he gave me a free coke.  I'll come back just for that simple gesture, oh and the pizza was pretty damn good too. Thin crispy crust with lots of cheese (but not too much) and basil (which could've been more)  Super fast service, and the pizza was piping hot.  It's nice that it's in the neighboorhood, so bonus points for that.

IIn3S9ZU4eq0njZ16Ic5-Q.text: Way too overpriced for what they have to offer. I ordered a pizza and a spaghetti bolognese and the cheese wasn't attached to the pizza, crust was hot but the center was warm, and the spaghetti was definitely reheated.  Ended paying 75 Singapore dollars for that small pizza and spaghetti along with some still water. Talk about a ripoff

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria L'Operetta - Singapore, Singapore

uGNfQshDSqBFb86wPayxEQ.text: Pizza is decent which is why I give it a 1 star. Reason why I would never go back again though is because I ordered a pizza + spaghetti and meatballs takeaway, only to find out that they forgot the spaghetti when I got home.  Pretty bad as it is given such a small order to forget something when not busy.. but.. happens. when i go back later to get a refund for the spaghetti and meatballs, the owner would only refund me the portion for the pasta, not the meatballs... hmm.. maybe i was just expecting too much that I should get a refund for the entire dish? needless to say. over $15, the cheap owner has lost a customer for life.

EbvagaMAb7CisexXdBUYSA.text: Come on. This is a great pizza place that has Verace certification. Yes, it is a little expensive but not more than Da Paolo which is worse (too thin, non-fresh mozzarella). Also, this is Singapore and their rent is probably $30,000/month and they are importing at least their tomatoes and mozzarella from Italy. This is the same price you would pay for this quality in New York or Seattle or Tokyo (and cheaper than Paris). This is also a more convenient location than Tanjong Katong, Operetta's other location which is much farther from an MRT station. AND they have a couple of red wines priced under $50.This place could be habit-forming.

BZkgCzodOxHI5SQGFdSyKw.text: Soooo this is no Dominos (which I guess is a plus for some) but it gets the job done when you're craving a cheesy, golden crusted pie. Serving up only the most authentic pizza, it's clear your paying for quality. Everything is freshly made so that's great and service is pretty quick.... So if you're in the area give this place a go!

DlNTW_q61NfUz5XMmwQMDA.text: I love this pizza place, this is one of not so many resto places in singapore that i would recommend to visitI love their margherita and prosciutto rucola

ZpZWHMoIuKptbKe9VcQ7LA.text: I'm revising my rating downwards. The pizza is good, but expensive.And it leaves a bad taste in my mouth when they deceive about the price.  I went for the 1-for-1 pizza from 2:30-5:30 pm every day.  The server told me the 2 most expensive pizzas are not included on 1-for-1. Fine, I order my pizzas.  When I go up to pay the bill, it seems higher than usual.  The waiter doesn't want to show me my receipt. He makes me pay before he shows me the receipt. When I finally see the receipt, it's not a pizza that I ordered!  And it's $30, whereas the most expensive pizza I ordered was $28.He said that the 1-for-1 deal was $30. That is NOT a one-for-one deal, that is 2 for $30 (and it's only certain pizzas).  Because they don't have it written anywhere or tell you, it seems like a deceptive practice to me.You should know this -- it would be a shame if you ordered 2 of the cheapest pizzas ($18, and end up paying $30 when you expect it to be $18.  Right???)When I expect a certain price but I end up paying more, it doesn't make me like the place very much.

ubGdBRJS2YIK37NaHXREuQ.text: The pizzas are tasty, the prices are outrageous.The average pizza is around $25++ - I'd say it's about a 12 inch diameter pizza (sorry I am not used to centimeters yet).Although tasty, I don't think this place does it for me when I get a hankering for good pizza. The day we came there was a special where you get 2 pizzas for the price of 1 which made it a bit more reasonably priced.I'll probably return due to the convenient location but it's eerie coming on the weekend b/c this place is a complete ghost town.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria L'Operetta - Singapore, Singapore. This is also a pizza.
Photo of Pizzeria L'Operetta - Singapore, Singapore. This is a pizza - I wish I remembered the name.
Photo of Pizzeria L'Operetta - Singapore, Singapore. ...which is why I think there were cute little birdies hanging out by our table, they hate the rain as much as us humans do!

5ba7biHqqzdk2lYVFiaDrw.text: Yay for having two toppings on one pizza! We tried the Mais and Diavola. Mais was cream sauce base with mozzarella/corn/ham/mushroom/basil/parmesan.Diavola was tomato sauce based with chilli/salami/mozzarella//mushroom/basil/parmesan.I guess a lot of the ingredients in those two pizzas are similar.. Anyway, fairly nice thin crust. The zing of the chilli on the Diavola was well appreciated :) Hence my preference for that slice! I found the salami a bit salty though, but that's just me not liking too-salty things in general.I think the pizza cost around $26++, somewhat pricey. Nice place to sit though!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria L'Operetta - Singapore, Singapore. Pizza with two types of toppings! Mais and Diavola

a-FC_3icbveXlT1AglrsXQ.text: Seriously people.  This place use great ingredients and we all know that any restaurant using quality stuff, end products ain't gonna be cheap.  Having said that, I think the quality of pizza certainly makes it worth the visit.  Atom sphere and service can be improved but this is a darn great pizza in Singapore.

Ps0TxDi-1dMe1h-kXfoU9g.text: I didn't expect to find a place that serve a New Haven like pizza or Napolean style. Good chewy thin crust that is slightly salted. Nice tomato sauce with alot of topping selection.

j4ncyBHYvwWT8kTQ4n3X5A.text: Ordered takeaway via RoomService App and it took 1hr 45 mins to get here. But the worst part is that the meal (pizza, calamari, pasta and salad) is one of the worst that I have ever tasted in my life anywhere in the world. If it was not meant for takeaway, the restaurant shd stop entertaining such orders.
